questions.question_text: Which NSX routing protocols offers the most flexible policy control when peering with the physical environment?

choices.A: Deploy NSX Manager, Configure Logical Switches, Register with vCenter, Deploy Controllers, Prepare hosts
choices.B: Deploy NSX Manager, Deploy Controllers, Configure Logical Switches, Register with vCenter, Prepare hosts
choices.C: Deploy NSX Manager, Register with vCenter, Prepare hosts, Deploy Controllers, Configure Logical Switches
choices.D: Deploy NSX Manager, Register with vCenter, Deploy Controllers, Prepare hosts, Configure Logical Switches

questions.question_text: What is the best practice workflow for a NSX installation to support logical switching?

choices.C: Each L2 bridge instance can only map to a single VLAN.
choices.A: There can only be one instance of an L2 Bridge on a DLR.
choices.B: Each L2 bridge instance can map to multiple VLANs.
choices.D: There can be multiple instances of an L2 bridge on a DLR

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding L2 Bridges and Distributed Logical Routers? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The correct answer is C & D 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-Data-Center-for-vSphere/6.2/com.vmware.nsx.admin.doc/GUID-E496C826-6DDA-4357-8D69-4AD21F8C2EEC.html?hWord=N4IghgNiBcIMYHsC2AHCBLMA7OBTABCghnOrgM4gC+QA

discussion.content:
I think is should be BC
bcause it does not support "U.S. Driver License and Social Security numbers", right?

choices.D: It only supports Windows-based virtual machines.
choices.B: It supports both Windows and Linux-based virtual machines.
choices.C: It only supports HIPAA and PCI-DSS compliance policies.
choices.A: It supports HIPAA and PCI-DSS compliance policies as well as U.S. Driver License and Social Security numbers.
